definition: "Becks", nickname of British footballer David Beckham (see 貝克漢姆|贝克汉姆[Bei4 ke4 han4 mu3])
small/tiny/few/young
cowrie/shellfish/currency (archaic)
surname Bei

sentences.english: Every now and then Justin and Audrey also love to doodle on the glass doors with markers.
sentences.chinese: 平時有事沒事大小貝貝還拿彩色筆在玻璃上塗鴉。

sentences.english: Just uploaded a batch of pictures of halloween, Tristan is the almighty wizard! Got quite some sweets.
sentences.chinese: 今天又整理出一批鬼節的照片，小貝是小巫師，呵呵。

sentences.english: Representatives of Beckham confirmed he had not made the calls.
sentences.chinese: 經貝克漢姆的經紀人證實，小貝並沒有打這些電話。

sentences.english: Mo is acted by Wang Shasha. She is a child star.
sentences.chinese: 莫小貝由王莎莎扮演，她是一個童星。

sentences.english: Justin and Audrey looked forward to everything and anything!
sentences.chinese: 小貝貝像是脫繮野馬似的到處衝來衝去。

sentences.english: Perfect timing for our horse-riding outing at Tamshui.
sentences.chinese: 帶著大小貝貝去淡水騎馬。

sentences.english: Audrey, you have given with my life tasted the Xibei.
sentences.chinese: 小貝貝，用我一生嚐盡你給的喜悲。

sentences.english: Bryan was enjoying running around the park without interruption from us.
sentences.chinese: 小小貝在公園裏撒歡地跑着，沒人阻攔。

sentences.english: It is obvious that the Beckhams will spend a lot of time to company their children.
sentences.chinese: 很顯然，小貝夫婦花了大量的時間來陪伴他們的孩子。

sentences.english: Around this time Audrey was toddling around behind Grandpa.
sentences.chinese: 這時小貝貝跟著阿公東看西看。

sentences.english: Uncle Meng Feng and Aunty MJ gave little Audrey a toy puppy.
sentences.chinese: 孟風姨丈和MJ阿姨送給小貝貝的玩具狗。

sentences.english: Lily: Yeah, and her fame almost surpass Beckham.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，她的的名氣快要超過小貝了。
莫小貝是佟湘玉的小姑子。

definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
sullen/to scowl miserably
happy/contented
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
unfair treatment/injustice
to keep up with the latest fashion
cheering excitedly (idiom)/jubilant
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
SS or Schutzstaffel, paramilitary organization in Nazi Germany
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
phonograph or radio (old term)/chatterbox/talkative person
Juliet or Juliette (name)
the Smurfs/Smurf
